Glacier ice is generally exposed at lower part of the glacier, while the upper glacier area is covered with accumulated snow. In the TEC analysis, we cannot obtain water-equivalent mass changes but trends in elevation changes. In eq. ( 1) there is some uncertainty in the density of snow or ice to estimate ΔM. ref.
2 included the uncertainty in ice or snow density in the TEC error (±0.02 m a −1) by taking surface conditions (ice or snow) into account.
